description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the kernel streaming service driver elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38244), ensure that the appropriate updates are applied to your Windows systems:

1. Determine your system's build number and Windows version.
2. Download and apply the relevant KB updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2, apply: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, apply: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, apply: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, apply: [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64), apply: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64), apply: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update addresses the improper input validation resulting in the elevation of privilege vulnerability. Ensuring your system is running the latest updates will close potential exploitation vectors.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify your system is running one of the specified Windows versions.
- Backup important data before applying any updates.
